channel.title: Ideas and the Theatre
channel.description:
The series presents a discussion of the current American theatre; its values, beliefs, patterns, and problems. Participants include Arthur Miller, Eric Bentley, Gore Vidal, Brooks Atkinson, Cyril Ritchard, Clinton Wilder, Tennessee Williams, and others.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Sex, fun and Jean Anouilh's waltz
item.description: A discussion of sex and how it is explored in theater, with a particular focus on Jean Anouilh's play "Waltz of the Toreadors."
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Drama--20th century--History and criticism.

item.title: George Bernard Shaw
item.description: This program focuses on the dramatic works of George Bernard Shaw.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Shaw, Bernard, 1856-1950

item.title: Tennessee Williams
item.description: This program focuses on the work of Tennessee Williams and includes Williams' own thoughts on the matter.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Williams, Tennessee, 1911-1983

item.title: Is the Theatre an influence?
item.description: A discussion of modern theater and whether or not it has an impact on modern society. Featured speakers include Gore Vidal, Tennessee Williams and Cyril Ritchard.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Influence (Literary, artistic, etc.)

item.title: Freud, Psychoanalysis, and Broadway
item.description: This program discusses the influence of Freud and psychoanalysis on 20th century theater.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Drama--20th century--Themes, motives.

item.title: The despair and religion of Eugene O'Neill
item.description: This program explores the worls of Eugene O'Neill.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Dramatists

item.title: A matter of hopelessness: Arthur Miller and "Death of a Salesman."
item.description: This program focuses on the importance of Arthur Miller and his play "Death of a Salesman."
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Drama--20th century--History and criticism.

item.title: Where the artist is the enemy
item.description: This program, "Where the Artist is the Enemy," analyzes Gore Vidal's play, "Visit to a Small Planet."
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Artists--Attitudes.

item.title: Social guilt in drama
item.description: This program focuses on "Social Guilt in Drama."
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Dramatists

item.title: Can we have ideas in the Theatre?
item.description: This program features a variety of contributors, like Gore Vidal, Brooks Atkinson, and Solon Kimball, asking if theatre can foster and promote new ideas in society.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Drama--20th century--Themes, motives.

item.title: T.S. Eliot
item.description: This program focuses on the dramatic works of T.S. Eliot.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Eliot, T. S. (Thomas Stearns), 1888-1965

item.title: Religious drama
item.description: An examination of the theme of religion as used in drama in the mid-20th century.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip
item.dc:subject: Dramatists
